net.proteusframework.core.locale

Class LocaleContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparator<TextSource>, EventListener, LocaleSourceListener

    public class LocaleContext
extends Object
implements LocaleSourceListener, Comparator<TextSource>, Cloneable
    The LocaleContext holds the current locale information and keeps a registry of LocalizedObject instances that are updated by calling LocalizedObject.localeChanged(LocaleContext) when the locale is changed.

    This class is not thread-safe.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    LocalizedObject

      • compareIgnoreCase

        public int compareIgnoreCase(TextSource o1,
                    TextSource o2)
        Compares two TextSource lexicographically, ignoring case differences.
        Parameters:
        o1 - the first TextSource.
        o2 - the second TextSource.
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer to indicate that the second TextSource is greater than, equal to, or less than the first TextSource, ignoring case considerations.
        See Also:
        Collator.compare(String, String)

      • getLocalizedObject

        protected LocalizedObject getLocalizedObject(LocalizedObjectKey key)
                                      throws IllegalStateException,
                                             LocaleSourceException
        Get the localized object that corresponds to the specified key and registers it for locale change events.
        Parameters:
        key - the i18n key.
        Returns:
        the localized object. Never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - indicates the method was called before the locale was set.
        LocaleSourceException - if the object could not be retrieved.

      • getLocalizedText

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the localized object. Never null.

        Returns:
        the localized object. Never null.

      • getLocalizedTextOrDefault

        public LocalizedText getLocalizedTextOrDefault(LocalizedObjectKey key,
                                      LocalizedObjectKey fallbackKey)
        Get the localized text that corresponds to the specified key and registers it for locale change events.
        Parameters:
        key - the i18n key. This key may be null in which case the fallback key is used.
        fallbackKey - the fallback key in the case of a missing localization.
        Returns:
        the localized object. Never null.

      • getLocalizedTextOrDefault

        public LocalizedText getLocalizedTextOrDefault(LocalizedObjectKey key,
                                      Object[] formatterArguments,
                                      LocalizedObjectKey fallbackKey,
                                      Object[] fallbackFormatterArguments)
        Get the formatted localized text that corresponds to the specified key and registers it for locale change events.
        Parameters:
        key - the i18n key. This key may be null in which case the fallback key is used.
        fallbackKey - the fallback key in the case of a missing localization.
        formatterArguments - the formatter arguments.
        fallbackFormatterArguments - the formatter arguments for the fallback.
        Returns:
        the localized object. Never null.

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(String language,
             String country,
             String variant)
        Set the locale and notify registered LocalizedObject instances.
        Parameters:
        language - A two character ISO language code.
        country - A two character ISO country code, may be null .
        variant - An application defined variant, may be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if language is null.

      • setLocaleIsImmutable

        public void setLocaleIsImmutable(boolean flag)
        Set that the Locale is immutable. This implies that the locale will not change. This causes any registered listeners for locale changes to be unregistered.
        Parameters:
        flag - the flag.

      • setLocaleSource

        public void setLocaleSource(LocaleSource localeSource)
        Set the locale source and clears any previously registered objects.
        Parameters:
        localeSource - The localeSource to set.
